newsitem.title: TOGO: Zaire's Mobutu expected to leave Togo later Friday.
newsitem.headline: Zaire's Mobutu expected to leave Togo later Friday.

text.p: Zaire's ousted president Mobutu Sese Seko is expected to leave the West African state of Togo on Friday, probably for Morocco, Togolese official sources said.

The veteran leader, who is fighting cancer, arrived in Lome from his jungle palace at Gbadolite in northern Zaire on Sunday night, a day after Laurent Kabila's rebels marched into the capital Kinshasa.
The sources said Togo's President Gnassingbe Eyadema, another veteran strongman, had spent about 40 minutes with Mobutu on Thursday. They said Mobutu remained very weak.
He initially landed in Togo for a technical stop but Togolese sources said the government had reluctantly agreed to let him stay longer because of his state of health.
French Cooperation Minister Jacques Godfrain hinted on Wednesday that France might be prepared to admit Mobutu for medical treatment.
Mobutu has received regular treatment for prostate cancer at a hospital in Monaco in recent months while recuperating from surgery at his palatial villa near the Riviera resort of Nice.
